subject: Proximus and Orange Belgium Reach Agreement on Mobile Network Sharing
overview: Proximus and Orange Belgium have finalized a long-term agreement to share their mobile network infrastructure. This deal, initially announced in 2019, will see the two companies operate a joint network, allowing them to reduce costs, improve network coverage, and accelerate the rollout of 5G technology across Belgium. The agreement covers the active mobile network equipment, including antennas and base stations, but excludes the core network. This collaboration is expected to enhance the quality of service for customers of both operators and contribute to a more efficient and sustainable telecommunications landscape in Belgium. The implementation of the agreement is expected to take several years.

subject: Proximus Announces New CEO, Guillaume Boutin to Step Down
overview: Proximus has announced that its current CEO, Guillaume Boutin, will be stepping down from his role. The company has initiated the search for a new CEO, and an interim CEO will be appointed to ensure a smooth transition. The departure of Boutin marks the end of his tenure, during which he oversaw significant strategic shifts and investments in the company's digital transformation. The company has not yet announced the reasons for his departure, but it is expected that the new CEO will continue to drive Proximus's growth and innovation in the telecommunications sector. The exact date of Boutin's departure and the appointment of the interim CEO will be communicated in due course.

subject: Proximus Reports Q1 2024 Results, Showing Stable Performance
overview: Proximus released its financial results for the first quarter of 2024, indicating a stable performance despite a challenging market environment. The company reported a slight increase in revenue, driven by growth in its fiber optic and digital services segments. However, the traditional fixed-line business continues to face pressure. Proximus highlighted its ongoing investments in network infrastructure and digital transformation initiatives. The company also emphasized its commitment to customer satisfaction and innovation. The results reflect Proximus's efforts to adapt to the evolving telecommunications landscape and maintain its competitive position in the Belgian market. The full financial report provides detailed insights into the company's performance across various segments.

subject: Proximus Expands Fiber Optic Network Rollout in Multiple Regions
overview: Proximus continues to expand its fiber optic network across Belgium, with recent announcements detailing new rollout plans in several regions. The company is actively working to connect more homes and businesses to its high-speed fiber network, aiming to provide faster and more reliable internet services. This expansion is part of Proximus's broader strategy to upgrade its infrastructure and meet the growing demand for high-bandwidth connectivity. The company is collaborating with local authorities and partners to ensure efficient and timely deployment of the fiber network. The expansion is expected to enhance the digital capabilities of the regions and support economic growth.

subject: Proximus Partners with Local Tech Startups to Drive Innovation
overview: Proximus has announced new partnerships with several local tech startups, aiming to foster innovation and develop new digital solutions. The company is collaborating with these startups on various projects, including the development of new applications, services, and technologies. This initiative is part of Proximus's strategy to leverage the expertise of the startup ecosystem and accelerate its own innovation efforts. The partnerships are expected to bring fresh perspectives and cutting-edge technologies to Proximus's offerings, benefiting both the company and its customers. The collaborations also highlight Proximus's commitment to supporting the growth of the Belgian tech sector.
